content.description: Stand start on some decent crimps, climb up and left through an undercling to good edges at about 10 feet. Continue straight up on good edges on good rock to an easy mantle. Somewhat off the deck but eases in difficulty up high. It is best to downclimb to a solid shelf and step across to the adjoining boulder to down climb.
content.location: From the pull out at Little Elden Springs, hike left/south along the base of the mountain on the AZ trail. Look up and right for a small corridor with some boulders at the base. There are also some larger cliffs above the boulder. There are also some decent 1 star warm ups in close proximity. Total hike time is about 5-8 minutes and Waterworks is directly opposite Mamba Mentality

content.description: Stand start on an opposing crimp and sloper sidepull. An interesting mix of power and technique will find yourself jumping to a crimp gaston just below the lip. This is one of the best pure lines on Elden and certainly deserves more traffic. We also did a stand start which allows you to do the jump with slightly different beta and is also very good.
content.protection: I would recommend at least 3-4 pads for the full line.
content.location: From the pull out at Little Elden Springs, hike left/south along the base of the mountain on the AZ trail. Look up and right for a small corridor with some boulders at the base. There are also some larger cliffs above the boulder. There are also some decent 1 star warm ups in close proximity at the base. Total hike time is about 5-8 minutes.

content.description: One of the better boulders on all of Elden. Start wherever feels good in the crack and make your way up utilizing good holds in the steepnes - finish out on sloping crimps that trend onto the right most boulder to an easy topout....
content.location: This one can be somewhat difficult to find but easy if you know what you're looking for. Hike to the base of elden via the AZ trail in a W/SW direction... From the base look up for an obvious leaning tree at a 30 degree angle or so. You must scramble up to this boulder problem but The Lean-to Crack is on a little bench right by the leaning tree... best of luck!

content.description: Interesting boulders in the area of Elden Springs. Good shade in the afternoon, Certainly potential for more problems here. Unique runoff provides pockets of excellent rock. Best in colder conditions if you want to get on harder problems.
